news_header: Bankruptcy applications surged in early 2024, with a record number of filings and bankruptcies among small firms in Finland.
news_original_title: Vuoden alussa tehty poikkeuksellisen paljon konkurssihakemuksia
news_text: In early 2024, Finland experienced an unprecedented rise in bankruptcy applications, with 128 enterprises filing in just the third week, marking the highest weekly total of the 2020s. Throughout the year, 3006 companies declared bankruptcy, the highest figure since the 2000s, predominantly affecting small businesses. This trend highlights significant economic challenges faced by smaller firms in the current financial landscape.
